snippet: In the rural town of Van, Tex., many were grateful that children were not inside when their schools were struck.
abstract: Three people remain missing after tornado hits Van, Tex, killing two people and injuring nearly 50 others; tornado is considered small scale in comparison to other disasters in state, but small size of town means destruction cuts even more deeply than it would in larger, more urban area.

byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: In the rural town of Van, Tex., many were grateful that children were not inside when their schools were struck.

headline.main: Tornado’s Destruction Cuts Deep in a Small Texas Town
headline.print_headline: Tornado’s Destruction Cuts Deep in a Small Texas Town
